Abstrak:
In the 1930s, many scientists derided rocketry. That failed to deter aeronautical engineer Frank Malina from developing the first US rocket to achieve extreme altitude: the WAC Corporal. Fraser MacDonald’s taut, deeply researched account of Malina’s career is
packed with luminaries such as Theodore von Kármán, and insights into the zeitgeist of a fraught era. Equally fascinating is Malina, who co-founded the Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California, yet — becoming “stuck in the reputational mire of McCarthyism” — was written out of space-age history because of his communist past
Fakultas: Fakultas Matematika dan Ilmu Pengetahuan Alam
Sumber: 4 J U LY 2019 | VOL 571 | NAT U R E | 35
